unicode.value: Sara, María Ángeles, Francisco, Rafael Lopera Rodríguez, Almudena Romero Romero

Este REA tiene dos objetivos: concienciar al alumnado de los factores que influyen en la interacción y plantear cómo el buen uso de estos factores afecta a la calidad de las relaciones interpersonales. Para ello, abordamos los siguientes temas: estructura de preguntas, frases cortas, comunicación no verbal y estilos de comunicación. El alumnado elaborará un informe sobre su perfil como interlocutor que incluirá el feedback de sus iguales. Este se consigue mediante la participación en una actividad de Speed Dating con las personas de la clase. Este REA prepara al alumnado para que pueda participar con éxito en esta actividad.

Hello everyone. In previous sections, we worked with animals’ names and adjectives both comparative and superlative. This is an amazing topic because everyone likes animals and learning about them is very curious. In today's lesson, we're exploring the animal world.

Let’s explore!

In previous sections, we worked with animals’ names and adjectives both comparative and superlative. This is an amazing topic because everyone likes animals and learning about them is very curious. In today's lesson, we're taking a look at the animal world and finding information about peculiar animals. Let’s explore!

                                                         

Lectura facilitada

Read

You worked with animals.

Tú trabajaste con animales.

You worked with animals’ names.

Tú trabajaste con nombres de animales.

You worked with animals’ physical features.

Tú trabajaste las características físicas de los animales.

Some animals are conventional.

Algunos animales son normales.

Some animals are extraordinary.

Algunos animales son extraordinarios.

Nature is amazing.

La naturaleza es sorprendente.

You like animals.

A ti te gustan los animales.

Animals interest you.

Los animales te interesan.

You have favourite animals.

Tu tienes animales favoritos.

Now, you think of animals.

Ahora, piensas en tus animales.

This help you with your final task.

Esto te ayuda con la tarea final.

Lesson 1. There are magical creatures in literature and cinema that can be inspiring, but in real life there are creatures that are just as amazing. In order to develop this project, your partner and you must follow these instructions:

a) find an amazing animal online.

b) describe the characteristics this animal: physical description, habitat, food, the reason why it is peculiar... To do it, you must complete the fact file on your computer. Find it below.

c) brief presentation about your animal in the second lesson.
2. A world full of surprising animals

You already know what your challenge is and the activity that will bring you closer to the goal. But to succeed in your journey, you will need some strategies that will help you in this and other similar tasks. Before you think or look for your animal online, pay attention to the characteristics of the animal. They must be special for a reason, find out facts about where they live, what they eat...  For example:

The tiger is an amazing animal. It lives in the South East of Asia and it's a carnivore animal...

At this point, you have chosen your favorite animal!

Each animal is special in a different way. What makes these animals special?  Think of your favourite animal, what makes it better than the other animals? Look at the following images and compare two animals. Don't forget to use comparative and superlative adjectives to describe animals. For example:

The cat is smaller than the lion. // The lion is the wildest animal.

Comparison one

Comparison two

Comparison three



Lectura facilitada

Read

Animals are special.

Los animales son especiales.

Animals are different.

Los animales son diferentes.

Each animal is special in a different way.

Cada animal es especial de un modo diferente.

You think of your favourite animal.

Tu piensas en tu animal favorito.

You wonder why your favourite animal is special.

Tú te preguntas porqué tu animal favorito es especial.

You look at the photos.

Tú miras las fotos.

You compare animals.

Tú comparas los animales.

You have fun.

Tú lo pasas bien.

Now that you have practice the vocabulary and grammar with the previous activities, chosen one animal and write down the information you have, it's time to fill in the fact file. Example:

Elaboración propia. (BY-NC-SA)

In this worksheet, you can write the information about your animal. Please, download it on your computer and fill in with information. Don’t forget to save it. 

Lectura facilitada

Read

Follow the steps:

Sigue los pasos:

1. You choose one favourite animal.

1. Tú eliges un animal favorito.

2. You download this worksheet.

2. Tú descargas la ficha.

3. You complete the worksheet.

3. Tú completas la ficha.

4. You use information about your favourite animal.

4. Tú usas la información sobre tu animal favorito.
5. LESSON 2 - Present your animal facts to the class
Now you are going to present the animal facts to the class. Remember to follow the order in the table and speak clearly. Your classmates need to guess what the animal is!

My animal description
 ExcellentGoodNot very goodBad
Use of adjectivesThere are many adjectives to describe the animal, mainly from the unit but also some new ones. (1)There are many adjectives to describe the animal, mainly from the unit. (0.75)There are some adjectives to describe the animal. (0.25)There aren't any adjectives to describe the animal. (0)
Use of comparativesThere are many comparatives to describe the animal, and no mistakes. (1)There are many comparatives to describe the animal, and some mistakes. (0.75)There are some comparatives to describe the animal but there are a lot of mistakes. (0.25)There aren't any comparatives to describe the animal. (0)
Organisation of the presentationThe presentation is super clear to understand all the details about the animal and the organisation is excellent. (2)The presentation is quite clear and the information is organised as learnt in the unit. (1.5)The presentation is a bit clear and there is some organisation in the information. (1)The presentation is not clear at all and the information is not organised. (0)
Animal designThere is an excellent animal design with parts from different animals and original features. (2)There is a good animal design with parts from different animals. (1.5)There is a poor animal design, not original and no effort. (1)There isn’t an animal design. (0)
ContentExcellent content with a very good amount of quality information and a varied description. (2)Good content with a good amount of quality information and a varied description. (1.5)Poor content with a not much amount of quality information and a repetitive description. (1)Not research done and very repetitive content. (0)
OralityExcellent pronunciation, intonation, pose, speech. (2)Good pronunciation, intonation, pose, speech. (1.5)Poor pronunciation, intonation, pose, speech with frequent mistakes. (1)Too many mistakes on pronunciation, intonation, pose, speech that makes very difficult to understand. (0)

Use the evaluation chart to assess your own work and your classmate's work.

Make a cross in the appropriate box.
Congratulations! You have finished your work. How do you feel? I think your work is really  amazing.
Let’s check what we have done. Are you happy with your work? Is it useful?

Título Faster than a cheetah
Descripción

A través de este REA, el alumnado será capaz de:

  • Comprender información sobre animales y sus características.
  • Diseñar y describir al animal ideal.
  • Comparar y hablar con los compañeros acerca de las características del mejor animal.
  • Organizar información para hacer una presentación oral.
  • Hacer una presentación sobre el animal ideal.
Personas elaboradoras de contenido Sara Cordero Giraldo, María Ángeles Pozo Montaño, Francisco Antonio Cañizares  Gallego 
Persona que modifica el REA Mª Isabel Moreno Expresati
Persona de Pedagogía Terapéutica Pilar López Fernández
Persona de soporte técnico Rafael Lopera Rodríguez
Persona coordinadora de ciclo Almudena Romero Romero
Persona coordinadora de la materia Rosario Reyes Márquez
Organización Dirección General de Formación del Profesorado e Innovación Educativa. Consejería de Educación y Deporte. Junta de Andalucía.

  • Sigue estos pasos para usar/redistribuir/modificar este REA:

1. Descarga el archivo fuente. Con esto tienes el recurso original en formato editable.

2. Modifícalo usando eXeLearning.

3. Si aun no lo tienes, descarga e instala el estilo EducaAnd.

4. Si lo modificas, has de reconocer la autoría y publicarlo con la misma licencia (CC BY-SA-NC).

Sara, María Ángeles, Francisco, Rafael Lopera Rodríguez, Almudena Romero Romero

Este REA tiene dos objetivos: concienciar al alumnado de los factores que influyen en la interacción y plantear cómo el buen uso de estos factores afecta a la calidad de las relaciones interpersonales. Para ello, abordamos los siguientes temas: estructura de preguntas, frases cortas, comunicación no verbal y estilos de comunicación. El alumnado elaborará un informe sobre su perfil como interlocutor que incluirá el feedback de sus iguales. Este se consigue mediante la participación en una actividad de Speed Dating con las personas de la clase. Este REA prepara al alumnado para que pueda participar con éxito en esta actividad.
Consejería de Educación y Deporte de la Junta de Andalucía.
